abstract: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, says the bank intends to keep its dividend of 30 cents a quarter unchanged.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, says the bank intends to keep its dividend of 30 cents a quarter unchanged.

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, who has been critical of the Volcker Rule, took a more measured stance on the regulation at an industry conference on Monday.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, who has been critical of the Volcker Rule, took a more measured stance on the regulation at an industry conference on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon has a love-hate relationship with the Volcker Rule. On Monday, he was showing the love.

headline.main: Jamie Dimon Shows Some Love for Volcker Rule

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is circulating a preliminary proposal to apply new rules not only to banks in the United States, but also American banks that have foreign units.
snippet: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is circulating a preliminary proposal to apply new rules not only to banks in the United States, but also American banks that have foreign units.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of JPMorgan Chase disclosing a multimillion-dollar loss in a London unit, financial regulators are weighing broad new oversight of overseas trading.

headline.main: Citing JPMorgan Loss, Regulator Pushes New Oversight

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
